local_tips: Minato is one of the few wards that offers both Japanese and English versions of the residence notification form for download on their website.
The main Shiba office tends to have the most English-speaking staff.
Forms can be submitted at any of the five regional offices or the Daiba Annex.
The Azabu office is closest to Roppongi and sees a high volume of international residents.
Japan Post Bank branches are everywhere in Minato — the Roppongi and Shiba Park branches see many foreign customers.
SMBC Prestia has flagship branches in Roppongi and Akasaka with full English-speaking staff — highly recommended for personal accounts.
MUFG's Roppongi branch is accustomed to foreign customers due to the embassy district.
Arrive before 2 PM. The Azabu post office is less crowded than Roppongi for JP Bank account opening.
Minato-ku has a high concentration of foreign-owned companies. Branch staff at major banks in this area are more experienced with foreign directors.
SMBC's Roppongi branch and MUFG's Toranomon branch have handled many Business Manager visa holders.
The Minato-ku Chamber of Commerce (港区商工会議所) can provide introductions to local banks — very helpful for corporate account opening.
Consider Johnan Shinkin Bank (城南信用金庫) — a local credit union with branches in Minato that is relatively friendly to small foreign-owned businesses.
